results.title: English at work
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Christine Sammers and Kay Donovan
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian mosaic”.
One of the greatest difficulties facing migrants arriving in Australia is the difficulty of acquiring English language skills. This video explores some of the innovative language courses being designed for work-places with a large number of non-English speaking background employees. The experiences of an older generation of migrants who received no English language training are contrasted with the experiences of more recent migrants who have found that English courses at work-sites offer a boost to their confidence at work. Apart from examining the benefits of English training at work, the video shows the conflicts arising between migrant and Australian-born workers, the latter often being initially resistant to the value of the courses.

results.title: English at work
results.brief_description: Designed to introduce migrants to aspects of Australian society and provide them with information and language required in specific contexts such as filing a tax return or buying a car.

results.title: English and Dutch colonization in the new world
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the beginnings of settlement in an English agricultural colony in Virginia, a Dutch trading colony in New York, and a Pilgrim colony in Massachusetts, and explains some of the basic motivations and patterns of colonisation.

results.title: England: home and beauty
results.brief_description: Domestic architecture, interior furnishing and the design of household objects were the subject of a protracted debate during the 1930’s. To increase Britain’s export sales, standards of design had to be raised, but there was no consensus for either of the two contenders-Bauhaus and Swedish inspired functionalism on the one hand or the jazzy modernistic Art Deco style on the other

results.title: England: background of literature
results.brief_description: Scenes of London, the countryside of Britain, the sea and the coast are used to illustrate a commentary consisting mainly of extracts from English literary works. Scenes include: Tower Bridge, Big Ben, St Paul’s Cathedral, Buckingham Palace, Westminster Abbey, the Thames, Houses of Parliament, Hyde Park, Glastonbury Abbey, York Minster, Stratford, the Lake District, the southern coastline.

results.title: England to Australia in under nine days
results.brief_description: A Fox-Movietone newsreel (vol. 3, ep. 19) from 1932 documenting the arrival of Charles Scott, the first person to fly from England to Australia in under nine days - as the title suggests. He lands in Sydney and is greeted by Sir Charles Kingsford Smith and welcoming crowd. Similar events in Brisbane are also shown.
results.title_for_label: England to Australia in under nine days

results.title: England Made Me
results.creator_credit: Atlantic Productions, Jack Levin and Peter Duffell
results.brief_description: Anthony Jarrant (Michael York) is a young, good looking Englishman whose had it easy all his life. Kate (Hildegard Neil), his sister, is more successful than him. She is secretary and lover to a ruthless German financier (Peter Finch) who arranges a job in Germany for Anthony. Anthony discovers that what he sees in the Germany of 1935 is not what he believes in - a discovery that inevitably leads to his downfall. Based on the novel by Graham Greene.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Atlantic Productions, Jack Levin and Peter Duffell

results.title: England in the Middle Ages
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films, Education Foundation for Visual Arts and David Boulton
results.brief_description: An overview of four hundred years of British history. Deals with the impact of the Norman Invasion; the Doomsday Book; the structure of medieval society; the importance of religion, castles, cathedrals and abbeys; the development of towns and trade; the Magna Carta; the Crusades; the beginnings of parliament; the Black Death; the decline of the fuedal system; the Peasant Revolt; the rise of the university and the Hundred Years War.

results.title: England-Australia on kerosene: Vicker's Viscount is amazing aircraft
results.brief_description: Cinesound Review No. 1198 newsreel. The story of the first Vickers Viscount aircraft bought in England for Trans Australia Airlines. The flight to Australia from London was made at 22,000 feet via Rome, Athens, Beirut, Karachi, Delhi, Singapore, Darwin and Melbourne and completed in an hour less than two days flying time.
